Summary: Tentative Agreement: Up to 4 representatives per side with flexibility for additional participants by mutual agreement.
Tentative Agreement: Monthly meetings for first year of Agreement, then quarterly thereafter, with flexibility for more or less frequent meetings by mutual agreement.
Tentative Agreement: No payment language included in final agreement (union proposal for PhD-level SGA payment not accepted).
Tentative Agreement: Committee discusses matters of concern to either party but cannot discuss active grievances, bargain, or reopen agreement.
Tentative Agreement: If provision found contrary to law, it has no effect to extent consistent with court ruling; remainder continues in full force and effect.
Tentative Agreement: Parties agree to discuss and renegotiate affected provisions within 30 days following written request; renegotiation may be delayed/paused by mutual agreement.

Union (01-28-25, Rejected): Comprehensive 5-part definition including machine learning, neural networks, cognitive systems, automated decision-making; excludes simple automation.

Union (03-25-25): University shall not discipline or dismiss GSW without just cause.

Union (04-11-25): Access through FERPA release identified in separate article; 1 year validity if not specified.

Union (04-11-25): Within 2 business days if material added outside normal course of business and systems can accommodate.
Union (04-11-25): Except when required by lawful subpoena, court order, or other applicable law; University will endeavor to inform GSWs where possible.

Union (04-11-25): Current and former GSWs have right to file grievance alleging violation of this article.
Union (04-11-25): Changes to discipline outcome as result of grievances and arbitration will be reflected in GSW employment record.

Union (02-18-25): Grievance is complaint/dispute arising from application or interpretation of specific provision; sole exclusive process for resolving grievances.
Union (02-18-25): Objective to encourage prompt resolution; parties make facts available; Union may present policy grievance at any step.
Union (02-18-25): Written statement of facts, provisions violated, remedy requested; must be signed/dated by Union rep or electronically filed; 90-day filing deadline.
Union (02-18-25): Meet with University rep closest to issue at Union discretion; may terminate at Union discretion; extends filing deadline by days pursued; no precedent.
Union (02-18-25): File with Dean and Labor Operations within 90 days; Dean meets within 5 calendar days; Dean decides within 10 calendar days.
Union (02-18-25): Appeal to Provost within 21 days; meet within 5 calendar days with Provost and Labor Operations; Provost decides within 10 calendar days.
Union (02-18-25): Submit to arbitration within 45 days of Step Two response; file with President and Labor Operations.
Union (02-18-25): AAA or Labor Relations Connector rules; decision within 45 days; arbitrator cannot add/subtract/modify terms; costs split equally.
Union (02-18-25): Standing panel of 17 arbitrators; 90 days to agree; each party may strike 2 per year.
Union (02-18-25): University forwards to Union within 5 calendar days; Union permitted at all meetings; documents sent to Union at filing.
Union (02-18-25): No reprisal for filing/participating; documents kept separate from personnel files; witnesses released from assignments when necessary.
Union (02-18-25): Calendar days counting; mutual agreement for extensions; semester transitions and winter break accommodations.
Union (02-18-25): File with Campus Contract Administrator within 15 days; meeting within 5 days; response within 5 days.
Union (02-18-25): Paid leave for arbitration hearings when conflicts cannot be rescheduled, with 15-day advance request; witnesses get paid leave for testimony.
Union (02-18-25): University may file grievance against Union; present to lead Union Steward within 14 days; if not resolved, may submit to arbitration.
Union (04-11-25): Defines dangerous (threat never mitigated), hazardous (mitigated by training/resources), unsafe (mitigated by training) tasks.
Union (04-11-25): GSW not assigned dangerous tasks; not assigned hazardous/unsafe without required training/resources; University provides safe workplace.
Union (04-11-25): GSW can refuse unsafe work without penalty; if threat exists, resolved promptly; if unable, remote work until resolved; full stipends until resolved.

Union (04-11-25): University provides PPE deemed necessary by OSHA or applicable regulations.

Union (04-11-25): Equal opportunity; no discrimination on 20 categories including race, caste, native language, sex, gender identity, political affiliation, union activities; failing to provide accommodation is discrimination.
Union (04-11-25): Failing to provide reasonable accommodation is discrimination (incorporated into non-discrimination definition).

University (08-26-24): Students may request additional time with supervisor; at discretion of supervisor/college; no precedent created for similar arrangements.
University (08-26-24): Time off must be used during term; will not carry over into succeeding term.
University (08-26-24): May not use both days together within first month of appointment except as allowed by supervisor.
University (08-26-24): Up to 3 paid personal days per academic year; accrue 1 per semester worked; carry over within year but not to following year; two weeks advance approval required.
University (08-26-24): No vacation provisions for hourly GSWs in University proposal.
Union (03-25-25): University directly pays in advance for lodging, transportation, conference fees; per diem at GSA/State Dept rates with 14 days notice via digital form; through NUCard and Concur.
Union (03-25-25): Expenses not paid in advance reimbursed via direct deposit within 30 days of submission; 60-day deadline from date expense paid/incurred for submitting requests.
Union (03-25-25): University provides personal/emergency health insurance for work-related travel with 14 days notice; includes Procurement Services rates, property insurance, trip cancellation.
Union (03-25-25): Emergency medical expenses covered by University or health insurance provider when certification from healthcare provider presented; no pre-approval required.
Union (03-25-25): University covers emergency repatriation/evacuation during GSW travel; coverage exceeds consulate minimums with no deductible.
University (03-25-25): Available at no cost on same terms as other campus organizations; subject to availability; may not disrupt operations; University reserves right to limit/revoke.
University (03-25-25): Non-student reps provide reasonable advance notice; requests for contract servicing meetings shall not be unreasonably denied.
University (03-25-25): Within 30 days of semester start and whenever updated, Union provides list of authorized representatives for grievances and bargaining unit work.
University (03-25-25): College mailboxes may be utilized by Union; Union has access to one bulletin board per college subject to posting policies.
University (03-25-25): University provides Union-supplied materials to newly admitted stipended students in PhD orientation packet; 30-day advance notice to Union.

Topic: Campus Orientation Notification and Speaking Time
Summary: University (03-25-25): University notifies Union of campus-wide GSW orientations ASAP but no later than one week before; Union gets 30 minutes at campus-wide, 20 minutes at college/departmental.
University (03-25-25): GSWs reserve right to Union representation in any proceeding implicating work status including cases where student status may be at risk.
University (03-25-25): Within 30 days after start of each semester, University provides basic info to extent permitted by FERPA.

Topic: Basic Bargaining Unit Information - Data Points
Summary: University (03-25-25): Name, home address (city/state/country only), major field of study, college.
University (03-25-25): Within 30-day period for those who submitted FERPA waiver by semester start, if info in University's possession.

Topic: FERPA Waiver Additional Information - Data Points
Summary: University (03-25-25): NU ID, home street address/city/state, cell phone, email, appointment title/department, home department, stipend/hourly rate, status, college, supervisor.
University (03-25-25): University maintains link to FERPA Release Form that can be accessed online; contents determined by University, subject to change consistent with FERPA.
Union (02-18-25): As condition of employment, GSWs must join Union or pay agency fee within 30 days; agency fee equivalent to dues; Union provides formula.
Union (02-18-25): Upon ratification, University and Union jointly notify GSWs of obligation; notice includes membership application and dues authorization from Appendix.
Union (02-18-25): University notifies each GSW at hire of obligation to pay dues/agency fees; notifies Union of new hires within a week.
Union (02-18-25): Upon Union notification of authorization, University deducts dues/fees from each paycheck; remits with electronic list including name, NUID, email, department, amount, wages.
Union (02-18-25): Payroll deduction can be changed by following Union process; Union notifies University of changed memberships within 10 days of receipt.
Union (02-18-25): University electronically transmits all dues and agency fees on first working day after each payday.
Union (02-18-25): Union indemnifies University from claims/actions/proceedings arising from deductions under Union direction.
Union (02-18-25): Failure to pay required dues/fees is cause for termination; University provides 30 days written notice before Union requests termination.
Union (02-18-25): University furnishes UAW V-CAP authorization form as part of standard payroll enrollment process.
Union (02-18-25): Union notifies University at least 30 days prior to any change in dues/agency fees amount; provides formula for calculating.
Union (02-18-25): Union reports missing/incorrect deductions; University corrects errors as soon as practicable after being informed in writing.
Union (01-25-24): There shall be no audio or video recording of any negotiations.
University (02-16-24): Student Bargaining Committee members represent that they will not participate in negotiations during their work hours.
Union (01-25-24): Length of bargaining sessions limited to 2 hours unless extended by mutual agreement of parties.
Union (01-25-24): Once negotiations begun, sessions take place at least once every 2 weeks until complete agreement reached; dates by mutual agreement.
University (02-16-24): Whenever possible, proposals submitted in writing and provided in electronic format.
University (02-16-24): University identifies location for bargaining ASAP in advance; provides private caucus location for Union; Union may request alternate location.
University (02-16-24): Each party designates one person as primary contact for communications when not meeting; communications to nugradworkers@gmail.com and s.merrill@northeastern.edu.
Union (01-25-24): Neither party obligated to produce copies of bargaining notes or minutes to other party.
Union (01-25-24): There shall be no agreement on any one item unless final agreement on all items.
University (02-16-24): Any counter-proposals shall be redlined so clear what changes are being proposed.
University (02-16-24): Bargaining limited to bargaining team/committee of each party; observers not allowed except by mutual agreement.
